elements.title: city in Virginia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a city in Virginia's 88.5-foot-tall (27.0 m) Christmas decoration (pictured) was so popular with residents that it was decided to light it nightly year-round?

elements.title: prehistoric women (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that prehistoric women may have had unique advantages over men in endurance hunting due to the positive effects of estrogen on muscle development?

elements.title: Andrew Still (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the actor Andrew Still worked as a receptionist and janitor after leaving Hollyoaks?

elements.title: Great Book of Marvels (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Great Book of Marvels has been called "one of the most valuable sources for the study of Chinese folklore"?

elements.title: Keith Marshall (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after no record label would sign Keith Marshall, his manager set one up himself and released his 1981 UK Top 20 single "Only Crying"?

elements.title: Shovel Knight: King of Cards (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the protagonist of Shovel Knight: King of Cards was compared to "a bad Renaissance fair actor who's gotten too far into his role"?

elements.title: Cui Chenxi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that skateboarder Cui Chenxi is the youngest Chinese gold medalist in the Asian Games?

elements.title: Six Poems by Marina Tsvetayeva (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in the Six Poems by Marina Tsvetayeva, Dmitri Shostakovich wanted to convey how he imagined the poet's voice, "husky, hefty, occluded in the smoke of homegrown tobacco"?
